thread.title: After over 400 episodes, the last of the Joy of Painting series was uploaded to YouTube today, let's take a moment to recognize one of the most wholesome human beings in television
thread.title_full: After over 400 episodes, the last of the Joy of Painting series was uploaded to YouTube today, let's take a moment to recognize one of the most wholesome human beings in television

author: /u/ThirteenPeeps
title: After over 400 episodes, the last of the Joy of Painting series was uploaded to YouTube today, let's take a moment to recognize one of the most wholesome human beings in television
text:
by ThirteenPeeps 
I'm not amazing with this kind of thing, so hopefully some of you can help me out in comments :) 
Bob Ross was not just a TV painter. Beyond extending the joy of painting to millions who might otherwise have never thought themselves capable, Bob taught us to believe in ourselves, in the amazing power hidden in each and every soul. He understood the value of different perspectives, and encouraged all of his viewers to embrace their own unique humanity. He recognized the importance of both tragedy and beauty in the context of life as well as nature. 
Beyond all this, Bob Ross was one of the kindest, gentlest spirits to ever grace our TV screens. For as long as he could, he worked to make this world a prettier place, one painting at a time. For that, I will always look up to him. 
Happy painting, Bob, and God bless.
